    ejiafzh

      • checkOrderPositionInQueueByCustomerId

        java.lang.Integer checkOrderPositionInQueueByCustomerId(java.lang.Long customerId)
        Check the order from where it is in the queue for the position using the provided customer ID. It is important to notice that the premium customers are always before the non-premium customers.
        Parameters:
        customerId - the provided customer ID.
        Returns:
        the position index from where the customer is in the queue. If there is no such order, it returns -1 for the given customerId.

      • checkOrderWaitTimeInQueueByCustomerId

        java.lang.Integer checkOrderWaitTimeInQueueByCustomerId(java.lang.Long customerId)
        Check the estimated time for the oder in the queue using the provided customer ID. It is important to notice that the premium customers are always before the non-premium customers. Estimated time is calculated by the quantity of the order. For example, if there are X customers before the given customerId and there each customer has N items to order, the estimated time is calculated as X + N + customer's own item quantity.
        Parameters:
        customerId - the provided customer ID.
        Returns:
        the estimated time for the order in the queue. If there is no such order, it returns -1 for the given customerId.

      • findAllReservedOrders

        java.util.List<Order> findAllReservedOrders()
        Find all the orders who order status is RESERVED.
        Returns:
        a list of reserved orders.
